image.altText: A woman cries

props.synopsis: When a fatal fire tore through seven high-rise towers in Hong Kong's Tai Po district, thousands of families were glued to a single webpage that offered updates far more quickly than official government briefings.

title.children: Hongkongers built their own SOS map as seven towers burned

image.altText: barnaby presser

props.synopsis: In the end, it turns out not even a Wagyu steak from Gina Rinehart's cattle company cooked on a sandwich press was enough to lock in Barnaby Joyce's defection to One Nation.

title.children: Hanson's high steaks dinner didn't get Joyce over line

image.altText: Murray Watt

props.synopsis: In his deal with the Greens, Environment Minister Murray Watt has just scraped off one of the biggest barnacles clinging to parliament.

title.children: Murray Watt has just cemented his reputation as a 'fixer'

image.altText: Barnaby Joyce speaking in the House of Representatives pointing behind him with his thumb.

props.synopsis: The former leader and deputy prime minister has confirmed his long-awaited political move.

title.children: Barnaby Joyce quits Nationals, will sit as independent

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and a man in a blue shirt look at the camera

props.synopsis: Laura Stokes and Adam Zerna describe spending time in an underground bunker as the category three cyclone passed over, before emerging to find an "apocalyptic" scene.

title.children: Caretakers huddled in bunker as ‘apocalyptic’ Cyclone Fina hit luxury lodge

image.altText: Housing under construction, worker climbing frames, wears shorts, white tee and hat, has tools belt around waist.

props.synopsis: Major housing, renewables and mining projects often get bogged down for years by Australia's aging environment laws. Now a deal to rewrite them could change that.

title.children: Waits on housing and renewables may have just gone from years to months

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiles as she hold a wrapped present while standing in front of a mural.

props.synopsis: The jury has been played a a covert recording of a conversation Rajwinder Singh had with an undercover officer in a police station cell in 2023.

title.children: Man accused of murdering Toyah Cordingley told police he saw 'killers' and 'ran'

image.altText: A man poses with his fist

props.synopsis: An emotional court hearing has been told the pain felt by the family of Min and Steven Cho after they were killed by a martial arts instructor almost two years ago.

title.children: Taekwondo instructor unable to explain why he killed three people

image.altText: Donald Trump looks serious has he wears a dark suit and stands inside an aicraft.

props.synopsis: The decision comes hours after US President Donald Trump said he was confident the suspect behind the shooting of two National Guard soldiers in Washington was from Afghanistan.

title.children: US stops processing immigration requests from Afghan nationals

image.altText: Beach signage with police tape across pathway

props.synopsis: One woman is dead and a man is in a critical condition after a shark attack at Crowdy Bay on the NSW Mid North Coast.

title.children: 'Courage from bystanders' praised after woman killed in shark attack

image.altText: A 'sold' sticker being placed on a 'for auction' sign outside a house.

props.synopsis: The banking regulator will impose restrictions on home loans from early next year to limit the number of "high-risk" large loans being issued to customers, which could have flow on effects in the housing market.

title.children: Home loan crackdown 'like banning eight feet tall people from restaurants'

image.altText: murder victim Lilie James in a car wearing a yellow top smiles as she takes a selfie

props.synopsis: A NSW coroner has urged young people to consider their use of location-sharing technology after the "senseless" murder of Lilie James at the hands of her ex-boyfriend.

title.children: Coroner releases findings into murder of Lilie James at Sydney school

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie speaking in Parliament, standing in front of a bench of his colleagues.

props.synopsis: The Environment Department projects Australia is expected to fall well short of its commitment to cut emissions by 62 to 70 per cent by 2035 — though the minister notes that is before accounting for a number of recent commitments.

title.children: Government projected to badly miss 2035 climate target, fall shy of 2030

image.altText: A soldier looks up at a damaged building as it is inspected by residents.

props.synopsis: One year after Israel and Hezbollah agreed to a ceasefire, the IDF is bombing Beirut again. And Israel has promised its latest strike will not be the last unless Lebanon's government does more to disarm Hezbollah.

title.children: A new war looms one year on from the Israel-Lebanon ceasefire

image.altText: A police cordon and police car out the front of a suburban Darwin home.

props.synopsis: A neuropsychologist tells the court an NT man accused of murdering an international student was not suffering from a substantial mental impairment at the time of the alleged crime.

title.children: Neuropsychologist in 'emphatic' disagreement over murder-accused's mental state

image.altText: A picture of a thoroughbred bay stallion standing in a paddock.

props.synopsis: Stud operators mourn the death of "beloved" stallion St Jean — whose son Half Yours won the Melbourne and Caulfield Cups — after breaking his leg in a paddock accident.

title.children: Sire of Melbourne Cup-winner Half Yours dies in paddock accident

image.altText: A woman stands in a party with her eyes closed as confetti rains down on her.

props.synopsis: November saw the return of two beloved franchises; magic-filled Now You See Me and action classic Predator — but can either live up to their predecessors?

title.children: Movie magic and manic mothers: Here's what's in cinemas this month

image.altText: A drone image of a metal construction platform standing on a tropical beach.

props.synopsis: A controversial glass elevator at one of Bali's most picturesque beaches will have to be dismantled, with authorities citing planning violations.

title.children: Glass lift at Bali beach set for demolition after governor intervenes

image.altText: A close up of Tom Phillips' face.

props.synopsis: Tom Phillips disappeared with his children in late 2021, in a case that drew global attention for his ability to evade arrest.

title.children: NZ launches inquiry into case of father who hid children in forest for years

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking, seen from lower down. The man is surrounded by microphones.

props.synopsis: What does a dead cat have to do with Donald Trump and the Epstein files? Everything, according to some experts.

title.children: The 'dead cat' theory could apply to Donald Trump and the Epstein files

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: Police say a search of an area of state park near Ballarat for missing woman Samantha Murphy may continue beyond Thursday.

title.children: State park search for Samantha Murphy could continue beyond Thursday

image.altText: The England team led by captain Ben Stokes leaves the field, looking dejected

props.synopsis: England are unlikely to tinker with their side for the second Ashes Test against Australia starting in Brisbane next week despite being thumped in the opening match, former fast bowler James Anderson has said.

title.children: Anderson expects England to pick same side for second Ashes Test

image.altText: Sea foam on a pavement next to the beach with a cyclist riding by

props.synopsis: Authorities say metropolitan testing shows Karenia algal levels remain low compared with last month, despite thick foam and fish deaths seen on some beaches in recent days.

title.children: Dead fish, foam seen on metro beaches despite overall low algal levels

image.altText: Empty bottles of spirits on a red dirt road.

props.synopsis: In the final hours of parliament for the year, the government has extended the time a person issued with a Banned Drinker Order is prevented from drinking alcohol.

title.children: NT parliament pushes through banned drinking register changes on urgency

image.altText: A firefighter fights a blaze

props.synopsis: An increased risk of bushfire is expected for parts of the country this summer, with most areas expecting hotter than normal temperatures.

title.children: Hot summer ahead leads to increased bushfire risk in parts of WA, NSW and Victoria

image.altText: Woman with a pram outside court.

props.synopsis: High school teacher Karly Rae, 37, pleads guilty to sexually assaulting a teenage boy in the Hunter Valley region.

title.children: Teacher pleads guilty to having sex with 15-year-old boy

image.altText: Pope Leo in red, white and gold regal robes smiling and waving with both hands on a red balcony next to two cardinals

props.synopsis: Donations to the Holy See in 2024 helped it turn around a 51 million euro deficit to record its first surplus in years, according to the Vatican's economic secretariat.

title.children: Vatican records first surplus in years, driven by $421m in donations

image.altText: A close up shot of blue and white police tape at night.

props.synopsis: An eight-year-old boy has been treated for non-life-threatening injuries after a reported stabbing at a school in Melbourne's south-east on Thursday morning, police say.

title.children: Eight-year-old boy injured in reported stabbing at Melbourne school

image.altText: Outside the ACT Fire and Rescue South Tuggeranong.

props.synopsis: The baby boy — estimated to be less than 24 hours old — was found Thursday morning outside a fire station.

title.children: Police concerned for mother after newborn baby found outside fire station

image.altText: Three SES personnel at a house assessing storm damage.

props.synopsis: Thousands of residents in Western Sydney are waking up without power and some schools across NSW will be closed after a freak storm on Wednesday.

title.children: Thousands still without power, schools closed after freak storm

image.altText: A generic photo of two teenage schoolkids sitting side by side, using their phones.

props.synopsis: The platforms, which can be used to make real people appear nude in photos and videos, have been used in several high-profile cases in Australian schools.

title.children: 'Nudify' services used by Australian school students blocked

image.altText: A woman hugs her father as they reunite surrounded by flood waters

props.synopsis: The Thai city of Hat Yai received its heaviest rainfall in 300 years, while mudslides killed dozens on the Indonesian island of Sumatra.

title.children: Floods leave at least 50 dead across Thailand, Indonesia and Malaysia

image.altText: Jeremy smiling at camera in black shirt

props.synopsis: Jeremy Webb died aged 16 after eating sausages while camping in the Central Coast. Growing up, he was bitten by ticks outdoors multiple times.

title.children: Teen's death from suspected meat allergy caused by ticks could be a 'first'

image.altText: A large group of activists dressed in red hoods and red gloves, stand on steps in Rome making heart symbols with their hands.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni says the measure will help "defend the freedom and dignity of every woman", following a series of killings and other violence targeting women in Italy.

title.children: Italy votes to make femicide a crime

image.altText: Advertisements for Black Friday sales are seen online on a mobile phone screen

props.synopsis: With millions of Australians tipped to spend record amounts this Black Friday, the value of personal credit and charge-card balances accruing interest has hit its highest level since 2021.

title.children: Black Friday 'social pressure' pushing some Australians into debt binge
